titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University UTS Ms. Tur. 1: Miʻrājīyah.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book and Manuscript Library UTS Ms. Tur. 1: Miʻrājīyah. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Columbia University, The Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book and Manuscript Library UTS Ms. Tur. 1: Miʻrājīyah.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

note: Inscription in ink signed Aḥmad ibn Kamāl and dated 1207 A.H. (1792 or 1793 CE) (second front flyleaf recto).

msContents.summary: A versified work about the Prophet's night journey (isrāʼ) and ascension (miʻrāj).

textLang.#text: Ottoman Turkish and Persian with some Arabic quotations and headings

name.#text: Turkish Manuscripts Collection (Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary)

persName.#text: Sunbulī, Muḥammad Darvīsh Nūr al-Dīn, active 1862

supportDesc.extent: ii, 44, ii foliated leaves : 186 x 121 (131 x 76) mm, bound to 187 x 128 x 17 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 15 lines per page in two columns.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Simple gold-colored headpiece (f. 1v); rubrications in red; borders and columns ruled in gold.

binding.p: Green cardboard with flap (type II); plain paper doublure.

origin.p: The item is undated; an owner's note places it before 1792; probably copied in the 18th century.

provenance: Formerly owned by al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Mudarris (note in ink, f. 1r)
Formerly owned by al-Sayyid Muḥammad Darvīsh Nūr al-Dīn Sunbulī and given as a waqf (pious donation) dated 1279 A.H. (1862 CE) (waqf notice f. 1r, stamps f. 1r-2r).
